Stanford University, Public Affairs Office Records

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Stanford University, Public Affairs Office records
did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence, memoranda, press releases, photographs, maps, and other documents concerning various events and controversies dealt with by the Public Affairs Office, 1960-1980. Subjects include the Stanford Linear Accelerator Center, Stanford Industrial Park, Ladera Dam and flood control on the San Francisquito Creek, Stanford in Britain overseas campus, dismissal of H. Bruce Franklin, ROTC on campus, the Winds of Freedom Foundation, and the inauguration of university president Kenneth S. Pitzer. Includes audio tapes of a press conference on KZSU with Stanford President Richard W. Lyman, May 30, 1972; and of a talk by John Kaplan to the Los Angeles Stanford Club on the Bakke case.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: Administrative transfer, Office of University Relations, 1973-1983.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stanford University, Public Affairs Office Records (SC0105). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The University Relations Office acted as liaison between the University and the public. The office was renamed the Public Affairs Office in December 1974 and was enlarged to include federal, state, and community government relations as well as other University relations activities.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, memoranda, press releases, photographs, maps, and other documents concerning various events and controversies dealt with by the Public Affairs Office, 1960-1980. Subjects include the Stanford Linear Accelerator Center, Stanford Industrial Park, Ladera Dam and flood control on the San Francisquito Creek, Stanford in Britain overseas campus, dismissal of H. Bruce Franklin, ROTC on campus, the Winds of Freedom Foundation, and the inauguration of university president Kenneth S. Pitzer. Includes audio tapes of a press conference on KZSU with Stanford President Richard W. Lyman, May 30, 1972; and of a talk by John Kaplan to the Los Angeles Stanford Club on the Bakke case.

did.unittitle: Stanford Linear Accelerator Center - powerline dispute

scopecontent.p: Includes schematic landscape design - Stanford Linear Accelerator. General plan building and End Station area. 1962 July 6; two informational pamphlets about SLAC.

Includes transcript of hearing by Joint Committee on Atomic Energy. Hearing on plans for supplying the electric energy requirements of the Stanford Linear Accelerator Project, SLAC - 1964 January 29; notebook summarizing the materials on the powerline controversy from 1964 January 16 to 1964 February 7. Includes copies of letters of principals involved in the controversy and relevant press releases, photographs and clippings.

Includes Paul McCloskey's Memorandum to the Board of Trustees re: proposed Searsville powerline compromise, 1964 February 13; abstract of talk by W.K.H. Panofsky to SLAC staff on "Powerline situation", 1964 March 5; press releases on the powerline dispute, 1964 March 23.
Includes photographs of the poles and sites in question.

Includes transcript of news conference conducted at site of SLAC with Chairman of the U.S. Atomic Energy Commission, Stanford Provost and Vice-President, Director of SLAC and the Vice-President of Commercial Operations, Pacific Gas and Electric Company, 1964 April 2.
Includes SLAC's collection of newspaper clippings re: the powerline controversy.

did.unittitle: Ampex annexation dispute - Extending of the industrial park

scopecontent.p: Includes miscellaneous documents re: Stanford's land development program, 1960-1961; miscelleaneous publications containing information on the Ampex controversy, 1960-1961; photographs of Coyote Hill, 1960.

did.unittitle: Ladera Dam controversy - San Francisquito creek flood control

scopecontent.p: Includes brief presented to the Board of Engineers for Rivers and Harbors, Washington DC, stating Stanford's position on the Ladera Dam project proposed by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, 1961 October 18; statement by Stanford Trustees relating Stanford's position and reasons for opposing the Ladera Dam project, 1961 October 19; TL Copy. To Dr. Sterling from Thomas H. Kuchel, U.S. Senator, on the progress of the San Francisquito project, 1962 February 23; a copy of a letter from Major General Keith Barney stating the reasons the army recommended the project over Stanford's objections 1962 February 8; confidential report to the Stanford Trustees on the status of the Ladera Dam project, 1962 February 27 with cover letter from the Director of University Relations, Lyle M. Nelson; confidential memorandum to Dwight Adams of the Stanford Business Office from Ray K. Linsley, Dept. of Civil Engineering re: San Francisquito creek flood control, 1963 July 9; press release summarizing the alternatives to the Ladera Dam, issued by Stanford's University Relations office, 1963 October 15.

did.unittitle: Ladera Dam controversy - San Francisquito creek flood control

scopecontent.p: Includes reconnaissance report on the floods of 1967 January 21-24; Santa Clara Flood Control and Water District, 1967 January.
Includes clippings and publications concerning Ladera Dam controversy.
Includes maps of the area involved in the controversy.
Exchanges between the Athletics Department and University Relations

Correspondence and miscellaneous documents relating to attempts to survey alumni opinion and to bring a closer working relationship between "fund raisers" and "friend raisers" during the PACE campaign
Miscellaneous documents regarding the Civil Defense Disaster Plan
Correspondence and miscellaneous documents regarding the retirement dinner given for Fagan, professor of economics [Public finance and taxation] at Stanford, 1928-1961.
Correspondence, newsclippings related to the loan of the Gov. Stanford to the Locomotive History Society for exhibit in San Francisco and its removal from the Stanford Museum.
Student radio station at Stanford
Sharon Heights license application
Correspondence, etc. relating to sale of liquor near campus
Press conference
The above four folders relate to the dedication of the first Stanford in Britain site, Harlaxton Manor, Grantham, Lincolnshire, 1966 April 16.
Correspondence and newsclippings related to the push for student self-government, beginning with the dismissal of Dean of Women, Lucile Allen.
Correspondence and newsclippings relating to Stanford's very successful summer festivals, including Shakespeare and Mozart performances.
Correspondence and miscellaneous documents relating to the effort to arm PACE volunteers with answers to recurring questions from donors.
Correspondence and other documents, including a transcript of proceedings, relating to this conference, held at Stanford (Lyle Nelson, coordinator; Bob Byers, publicist)
Invitation to the dedication of the plaza and its fountain and artists drawings.
The above two folders of correspondence and other documents relate to the first organized effort by conservative alumni to curb "rampant" liberalism at Stanford.

did.unittitle: Brigham Young University (BYU): University Human Relations committee

scopecontent.p: "The Brigham Young Decision" summary by Andrew Doty, and other correspondence.
With some background to the problem
: R.W. Lyman - Weekly Press Conference KZSU, 1972 May 30; Robert M. Brown - KZSU, 1972 May 30 and Public Affairs - John Kaplan to L.A. Stanford Club on Bakke case
